definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Introduce our final project, begin preparations. Rehearsal time and resource creation.
sentences.chinese: 準備結題，寫出計劃，開始排演。

sentences.english: A group of actors are rehearsing a play about Joan of Arc.
sentences.chinese: 一個藝術團正在排演一部有關聖女貞德的戲劇。

sentences.english: I gave the kids roles and staged one of our school meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我給孩子們分配角色，排演了一次我們的學校會議。

sentences.english: Rehearse several times before the big talk.
sentences.chinese: 在大型演講前多排演幾次。

sentences.english: They planned to stagger our rehearsing hours.
sentences.chinese: 他們打算錯開我們的排演時間。

sentences.english: It was the scene which had pleased the director at the rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 這場戲在排演時曾大得導演的賞識。

sentences.english: The play met with approval and was quickly put into practice.
sentences.chinese: 劇本意外地獲得批准並很快投入排演。

sentences.english: Ballet Rehearsal on the Stage, by Edgar Degas.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞團排演舞臺上，由埃德加德加。

sentences.english: Please enjoy the drama club rehearsals blue drama midsummer night's dream.
sentences.chinese: 請欣賞藍天話劇社排演的話劇《仲夏夜之夢》。

sentences.english: Then act them out with your child so he can practice how to respond.
sentences.chinese: 之後把這些排演出來，讓你的孩子練習如何應對。

sentences.english: Dancers rehearse in the hometown of the Kirov Ballet.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演員們在基洛夫芭蕾舞團的故鄉排演。

sentences.english: The rehearsal will start at 9 o'clock. There is still half an hour left.
sentences.chinese: 這個排演9點鐘才起頭，咱們另有半鐘頭無事可做。

sentences.english: She worked like a demon all through rehearsals.
Lunchtimes were spent reading over my lines and talking about what I would wear.
sentences.chinese: 我們利用午餐時間來排演，並討論我當天的服裝。

definition: to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
audition/dress rehearsal/preview (of a theatrical performance)/dummy run
opera highlights performed as independent pieces
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
